HONG KONG 0-0 DPR KOREA



The result for DPR Korea meant that they retained top spot in the standings, tied with Hong Kong on four points but ahead due to goal difference. DPR Korea are also one of the hopefuls who will be competing for Continental glory next January at the AFC Asian Cup UAE 2019.


Hong Kong, who had defeated host nation Chinese Taipei 2-1 in their opener, had several glimpses of the goalmouth through Paul Olivier Ngue’s efforts but it was DPR Korea goalkeeper Ri Myong-guk and his opposite number Yapp Hung Fai who were the stars of the match with their saves.


The second half saw DPR Korea gain more momentum but were left to rue their missed chances as they head into their final fixture against Chinese Taipei, while Hong Kong will take on Mongolia on Friday.


Photos: Chinese Taipei Football Association

http://www.the-afc.com/news/afcsection/hong-kong-dpr-korea-draw
